headline.main: Tyson to Acquire IBP in $3.2 Billion Deal

lead_paragraph: Tyson Foods Inc., the poultry giant, reached an agreement yesterday to acquire IBP Inc. in a $3.2 billion deal that would create the world's largest meat producer and processor, with revenue of about $23 billion. The cash-and-stock acquisition ends a battle between Tyson and Smithfield Foods for control of IBP, the nation's biggest packer of fresh beef and a leading pork processor.
